summary: This document is an email chain from June 2024 between attorney Erica Dubno and an FBI Special Agent, discussing the urgent correction and submission of a draft letter from the FBI in support of a victim's application, likely related to the Epstein case. The correspondence references prior collaboration with Sanctuary for Families and a U.S. Attorney's office.

persons.name: Erica T Dubno
persons.context: Attorney from Fahringer & Dubno who is coordinating the submission of a corrected FBI support letter for a victim's application, expressing urgency and apologizing for a mistake in the draft.

persons.name: Jessica-Wind Abolafia
persons.role: Director, Anti-Trafficking Initiative at Sanctuary for Families
persons.context: Correspondent from Sanctuary for Families involved in 2022 communications regarding finalized forms and follow-ups with the FBI related to supporting a victim.

persons.name: Alexander
persons.context: Mentioned as being copied on an email regarding a 2020 communication about the victim's application.

connections.description: Working together on legal matters related to a victim, with Dubno as attorney and Abolafia from Sanctuary for Families providing support.
Dubno references prior email chain with AUSA Alexander from 2020 regarding the victim's application.
Abolafia communicated with an FBI Special Agent in 2022 regarding finalized forms and follow-ups related to supporting a victim.

events.title: Deadline for response submission
events.description: The deadline by which the full response, including the corrected FBI letter, needs to be sent out.

events.title: Finalized forms submission
events.description: An FBI Special Agent sent finalized forms to Jessica-Wind Abolafia, related to supporting a victim.

events.title: Prior communication with AUSA
events.description: Reference to an email chain with AUSA Alexander in 2020 regarding the victim's application.

keyFacts: An attorney is urgently seeking to correct and submit a letter from the FBI in support of a victim's application, with a deadline of June 20, 2024.
The correspondence involves collaboration between a private law firm (Fahringer & Dubno), Sanctuary for Families' Anti-Trafficking Initiative, and the FBI's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Desk.
The FBI had previously provided a supportive letter in 2022, and there was prior communication with a U.S. Attorney's office in 2020 regarding the same matter.
The document highlights ongoing legal efforts to support a victim's healing and application process years after the underlying events.
